sentences.sContent: Don’t talk with your mouth full.
sentences.sCn: 嘴里塞满东西时不要说话。

sentences.sContent: The class is full, but you can register for next term.
sentences.sCn: 这个班已经满了，不过你可以注册下学期的。

sentences.sContent: The bath was full to the brim (= completely full ) with hot water.
...A recent study of people with HSAM reveals that they are liable to fantasy and full absorption in an activity...
...What could have been considered the beginning of a descent is now a potential turning point—the turning point you are most equipped to take full advantage of...
...figuring I had a full week to do the research...
...Capital cities are full of tourists and are never very friendly...
...because although it's full of rich people...
...giving your full attention to the speaker and making an effort to shift the focus of the conversation to the other person...
...Keep the gas tank as nearly full as you can...
...He asks that you pay full attention to how your mind and body interact with computers and how your attention and creativity are influenced by technology...
...we should make full use of those elementary skills...

synos.tran: 完全的，完整的；满的，充满的；丰富的；完美的；丰满的；详尽的

phrases.pCn: 骄傲；臭美；自以为是；只顾自己
全音域，全频；全距；全馏程
全尺寸；原大的；完全的；全刻度的；满量程
达到活动的高潮；全力进行中
全方位服务；（英）做礼拜时全部颂歌的乐谱

trans.tranOther: containing as much or as many things or people as possible, so there is no space left
